website_summaries.verdict: This compact compass may appear simple at first glance, but it's packed with all the bells and whistles you could hope for.
pros: Global needle that works accurately anywhere on the planet
Luminous markings for easy readings, even at nighttime
cons: The brand logo sits directly on the compass dial, and some say this makes it a little difficult to see the needle alignment

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get what was ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Suunto MC-2G Global Compass. I got a MC-2 NH. It didn't have a mirror. Where the mirror was supposed to be was a silver piece of cardboard. I couldn't even see myself in it. Also I think it was defective since the declination needle rotated like a minute hand on a watch. The order was filled by dipndive. This is a dive shop.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Big quality control problems!
customer_reviews.text: I am so bummed out. Bought two of these for a Mountaineers Wilderness Navigation course and took them into the field today. Both compasses had sticky needles and would not work reliably. I thought I could return them but my return window closed 10 days ago. So I’m out close to $100 on these broken items. Amazon, please help! Update: amazing Amazon customer service made me whole on the order. I will be buying a Silva Ranger.
customer_reviews.author: jjordanpalmer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Versatile, Durable, and Light.  Worth Every Penny and No Batteries Needed.
customer_reviews.text: A gift from a former hiker/climber to his son, I looked through a lot of reviews and this came out in the balance of functionality, accuracy and durability. In the age of GPS, some newbies ask "Why a Compass? The simple answer is battery failure and the reality that a well understood com-pass and chart is still the best way of understanding not where you've been, or where you are, but in which direction to take your next step. Suunto has the best (and universally good) reputation of all but a few very expensive boutique compasses. It would be hard to beat this combination of accuracy and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking compass
customer_reviews.text: The materials are a little cheap. I think they could have done better with the mirror. I think it is a little bit on the pricey side. So far all in all is good. The declination is easy to set up. The bezels nice as well as the plate. The markings are clear and clean as readable. Have not got a chance to use this much. I have been using another form of location navigation. I travel a great deal and live on the road the whole West coast I have stash boxes all over the countryside stuff to store for later use buried underground. I mark it with a set of coordinates to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Picture I Think
customer_reviews.text: I haven't use the compass yet! This is more a review of the wrong product pictured (I think). I order the one I wanted. In particularly, I wanted the one without "Suunto" under the needle. However, the product I received was not the one pictured. The one I ordered was the "G Mirror Compass", but it looks like I received the "NH USGS Mirror Compass" (at least as close as I could tell based on the pictures). The product does have "G Mirror Compass", but it wasn't what I wanted. It does appear to function correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Bacchuss

customer_reviews.title: Faulty compass neeedle movement
customer_reviews.text: The compass needles would not rotate, especially when the flat baseplate of the compass was in a level/horizontal position. And it looked like the N/S needle was hanging up on the inclination needle, when it did move. I would not purchase this item through Amazon.com but instead directly through Forestry Suppliers, which is the US distributor for SUUNTO compasses. Forestry Suppliers also has a couple of compass bags for protecting this compass.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dundas

customer_reviews.title: Forget about the military compass
customer_reviews.text: Forget about buying a military compass. Military compasses are way over priced and are pretty much a stripped version of the MC-2G. This compass is definitely worth the price. Just make sure you set your declination for your location and the red is in the shed. The only downside is not the product but rather the advertising picture during the evening hours. the only thing that glows is the dial ring not the base plate numbers. I give the product 5 stars and the advertising 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Slow-N- Low

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: When opening the cover, there is a click, almost as a weapon safety coming off. Not good when trying to remain silent. Thought it would be superior to GI lensatic compasses, and it might be, once I get accustomed to driving it. Consider it to be my backup compass to the GI compass I have been using for over fifty years.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Feels fragile
customer_reviews.text: I look at the pictures and it seems like you might be able to fold the compass closed. You can't! It's either going to lay out flat or it's going to be folded at about 90 degrees. Neither position is going to be easy to carry around if you're out hiking somewhere rugged. I feel like I would shatter it's hinge or break it in some other way within 2 days of being outside. Otherwise, it was very accurate and easy to read. It just feels too fragile to use so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: SRA

customer_reviews.title: One of the best mirror/baseplate compass available
customer_reviews.text: Compasses are low tech devices and for a mechanical device to work well, it requires quality materials and manufacturing similar to a mechanical watch. I put a detailed review here, with photos to insure the review is catalog in the right model for the variant I received.
customer_reviews.author: James Q. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Temperatures not accurate in oven.
customer_reviews.text: Not only did this not read the correct temperature in my refrigerator, it read the wrong temp in my over, plus it melted! Yeah... dad jokes... The compass works really well, and I love that its global. Just set the declination (I cheat by using my GPS reading) and you are good to go. This lost 2 stars because the logo is in an awful location on the face of the compass. While it doesn't hurt the basic functionality of the compass, its distracting when using the orientation lines.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Moreno II

customer_reviews.title: Scratched right out of box
customer_reviews.text: Compass mirror is scratched up. I’m not sure if I got a used or refurbished compass. For the price I paid for this thing, you’d think it would be in better condition.
customer_reviews.author: Rill

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasts; didn’t last for me
customer_reviews.text: This liquid-filled compass worked nicely for a while, until it developed an air bubble in the liquid. The air bubble moves the compass needle around much more effectively than earth’s magnetic field, rendering the entire instrument worthless. Once the air bubble forms, a cheap, toy compass would be more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Great compass but...
customer_reviews.text: This really is the best mirror sighting compass out there. It is very accurate. I have been using it for search and rescue. So why only three stars? First off my mirror started to corrode under the glass. It did not have any chemical or anything like that spilled on it. The other big issue that kind of made me mad is the model shown in the picture is the metric model I needed. However what was shipped was the US version in miles. I did not feel like sending it back for just that but every time I look at it I get angry that I did not get what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: CharadeUR

customer_reviews.title: This compass is flawed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used suunto compasses for 24 years without any issues. This new compass Design does not work right. The needle sticks and hangs up. There’s definitely a design flaw. I can spin this compass 360 degrees and the needle sticks in place. I called suunto of USA they sent a new one which also had the same issue. I don’t recommend this compass. The old design was an excellent design and worked flawless for many years. I hope they go back to the original design.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite precision compass!
customer_reviews.text: After decades of using the Silva Ranger... I am so impressed by this Suunto model! Also, some people questioning if the units on the rulers are in inches or centimeters and, as I have expected for the "Global" model, both units of measurements are presented. One of the drawbacks of years long usage is that the red markings on the baseplate are fading, as they are being rubbed off, etc. I'll do some research if there is a clear resin that can be applied in order to protect the markings. If anybody who reads my review has any suggestions, please feel free to share.
customer_reviews.author: udor

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD COMPASS
customer_reviews.text: FIRST OF ALL I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO TAKE IT INTO THE FIELD AS OF YET. MY FIRST IMPRESSIONS ARE THE COMPASS IS OF VERY GOOD QUALITY AND THE CONTROLS ARE EASY TO USE. THE ISSUE WITH THIS GLOBAL MODEL THAT IS A MINOR CONCERN IS I WISH THE SCALES PROVIDED WAS IN 1:24000 INSTEAD OF THE 1:25000. I LATER FOUND OUT THIS IS THE CASE ON THE USGS MODEL HOWEVER THAT ONE IS NOT A GLOBAL NOT THAT IT WOULD MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE FOR ME BECAUSE I DONT GET OUT OF THE US TOO OFTEN AND EVEN THEN TO BE THAT SOUTH OF THE EQUATOR WOULD PROBABLY BE NEVER.
customer_reviews.author: john danforth

customer_reviews.title: Great compass!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a number of other compasses and never gave it much thought. Then with those compasses I cam into an area where I was concerned about my location. I have not checked the declination and struggled somewhat with location. I finally got out but swore I would research a product that had an adjustable declination and climb indicator. This Suunto is just that compass. It is well made and has many features for the price. The declination is adjustable with an attached small screwdriver and the climb indicator is accurate and easy to read. I highly recommend this compass!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Raggio

customer_reviews.title: Very good compass!
customer_reviews.text: As an avid backpacker I've used many compasses in my lifetime. I didn't take this one seriously at first, but it turned out to phenomenal right out of the box! I'm going to be using it often. Make sure to keep it away from metal and magnets while sighting. It's very sensitive to magnetic fields. (The little metal thing on the lanyard is the screwdriver for declination adjustment)
customer_reviews.author: Phillippe Nile DeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Quality Compass
customer_reviews.text: The Suunto MC-2G has the features (adjustable declination, sighting mirror, etc.) you would expect in a quality compass and it's made in Finland. I purchased this compass for a weekend backpacking trip and wasn't sure whether I should get one w/ or w/o a sighting mirror. Glad I went with this one and can't imagine getting an accurate bearing w/o the mirror. The declination is easily adjusted w/ a small key that is included on the lanyard w/ the compass.
customer_reviews.author: C Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband's birthday. Read a couple of reviews by ex military guys here which was very helpful in choosing the right model. I am not an expert but learnt a couple of things on the way towards buying these. Personally I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: bhat01

customer_reviews.title: Needs a minor instruction booklet addition but few better compasses exist.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece. One minor gripe is that there are not, if anyone might need them, any hints beyond the picture on the Amazon website, as to how to attach lanyard. It is not difficult but neither is selling a $60+ compass with inclusion of a pic and a paragraph of info on retaining it afield. The total package is excellent however.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Cozad

customer_reviews.title: Suunto thought of everything.
customer_reviews.text: The wife loves it! We went to IOLS training and fell in love with orienteering This is a superb compass. It may cost a little more but it is extremely well designed and produced. Suunto thought of everything. I had considered trying to save money by not getting the "global needle" because I don't plan on going off continent with it. I am really glad I decided to get this needle system! By preventing needle hang ups it makes the compass really fast to use! The global needle system is absolutely fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: You Ask !
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just receive a bad one, but out of the package it didn't work, as in needle did not move. I thought it was supposed to be more accurate, seemed cheaply made. My other ones from other manufacturers at least work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent compass
customer_reviews.text: very well built compass, easy to use. jeweled bering on the needle. lots of features in a compact rugged compass.lightweight. great compass for the money.
customer_reviews.author: E-Z BREATHER

customer_reviews.title: get one
customer_reviews.text: my four year old was able to use this :) great readability, has great features, well packaged and shipped. not too sure how long the etching will last but everything is sharp now and i expect to get years of use out of this compass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful compasses
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these total. One for myself and two for some friends of mine, these are very useful compasses. The mirror works nice for setting a course and and everything else on it is nice and sturdy. The only complaint I could make is the SUUNTO logo emblazoned across the lower part of the compass that blocks the lines that could otherwise be used on a map.
customer_reviews.author: Jerad Cudiamat

customer_reviews.title: Logo in the way
customer_reviews.text: The photo lies. The logo is in the way on the Global model too. I didn't return it because it's probably still the best in the price range on the market. Otherwise it seems sturdy based on some experience with other compasses.
customer_reviews.author: JimWilly

customer_reviews.title: I’ve used this kind of compass since 1965. This one is very good
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Quality compass, probably more accurate than most users ability to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made compass.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better made compasses on the market today. It is pricey for what it does. The MC-2 Pro is exactly the same but the gimbal mount for the magnetic needle is different and does not allow as much verticle movement so it only works in the hemisphere you buy it for. Unless you are traveling and exploring in both hemispheres, the less expensive version is just fine. I would recommend either one of these, depending on wheere you plan on travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great compass.
customer_reviews.text: This has all you need in a compass. The mirror has other uses as well like signaling and fire starting.
customer_reviews.author: Titanium 7

customer_reviews.title: The standard in usability
customer_reviews.text: The light weight design and accuracy really cant be beat for someone who will referencing a compass often. The first one I was sent was actually defective but was promptly replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Finland Quality Compass with Global capability.
customer_reviews.text: World usable compass that has everything you need. I bought two in case they become unavailable or in case the manufacturing moves to a less quality oriented country. Very well made in Finland, not the low quality compasses you hear about from China.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Two different versions (metric and inch) and no way to tell what you're getting.
customer_reviews.text: This would've been a great compass. I read the reviews, MOST were saying specifically this was the INCH version, which is what I wanted. I placed my order. I received my new shiny compass in the mail to see that there are 1:50K (METRIC) roamer scales on it. I emailed the seller, and they are working the return, at my cost of return shipping. Amazon needs to be specific which compass you are buying here. There are 2 version, which could look identical if you aren't careful. I placed another order for a compass, but this time a Suunto M3-Global. Hopefully this will have the USGS scales on it.
customer_reviews.author: HardLuck682

customer_reviews.title: Great compass
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tracking compass I've ever owned. It has so many features to many to name in this little review. It doesn't have to be perfectly flat to function, auto deviation, large mirror for tracking, to name a few. I highly recommend this compass.
customer_reviews.author: Mik Sivad

customer_reviews.title: My only choice for a primary compass
customer_reviews.text: I researched my compass selection for days before buying this. It lives up to all of the hype. It's accurate, accommodates a wide range of tilt, and any geographic location. The mirror works beautifully for siding, and the rotatable bezel holds its position. It's a great choice for a primary compass.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: The compass I received from this listing has the international ...
customer_reviews.text: The compass I received from this listing has the international scale printed on it (1:25000, 1:50000, etc.), rather than the standard USGS scale (1:24000, etc). Not a problem for me since I can do math, but maybe an issue if you weren't ready for it.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: comes with great instructions
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, taking my trip in a few weeks. Giving it 5 stars on accuracy may be premature but I didn't want to hurt its ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Timms

customer_reviews.title: Compass
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff to open and close but just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Compass
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this product because it is not what I ordered. I ordered the USGS Roamer version and received the metric version.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Martin

customer_reviews.title: Umm that way, right?
customer_reviews.text: It has a lot of great features that are useful. I need something that can be trusted and this compass does not disappoint. I have used it outside below freezing and also put it in a freezer so I can say it works in all different conditions. The luminous paint and dial are good enough to navigate with at night if they get charged a bit, so that is a plus to not have to use a light constantly when checking your bearing.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: excellent compass
customer_reviews.text: I like the dip needle for measuring slope. i bought the global version because the needle bearing has more dip range for quick meassurements.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with a MC-2
customer_reviews.text: Great compass for anywhere in the world. They knew what they were doing when they built this one. I wish they would come with a longer lanyard and a carrying case!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazon compass for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner in the classic navigation field and this compass is easy to use and precise enough for my needs! I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gargioni

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets!
customer_reviews.text: One of two compasses that stays on my belt in the Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: King_Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate, easy to use, and surprisingly rugged. Comes with a useful user's manual with additional tips.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel B Lewis

customer_reviews.title: they are selling the English unit version
customer_reviews.text: I have used other MC2-G compasses from Suunto and prefer them above all others. I just received my own MC2-G from Amazon and it is fine. If I could change anything, it would be to add a 1:24k UTM corner scale/roamer, and I'd like the markings on the bottom of the baseplate to be etched & inked instead of only inked. The reviews here are accurate, I just want to point out that the version being sold is the English unit version with 1:24k and 1:62.5k scales and no roamers. The photo is of the metric unit version with 1:25k and 1:50k scales plus metric roamers.
customer_reviews.author: WoodsWalker

customer_reviews.title: Suunto MC-2 Line Highly Rated for Wilderness Travel
customer_reviews.text: I've used Suunto compasses for around 10 years as a Wilderness Navigation instructor. Both the mirrored and more compact hand bearing, declination adjustable versions are rugged, reliable and kind to the user in difficult terrain and wild weather.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: good compass
customer_reviews.text: Durable, accurate compass. Have beat this up on multiple trips this past year and has held up well. Easy to read and adjust and combines well with forrest service maps in the US and topo maps for Switzerland.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, I can't give this compass a complete review ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I can't give this compass a complete review because it arrived yesterday defective/damaged. I ordered the Suunto MC - 2 Global compass but I received my package to find a small hairline crack in the dial. I think some of the fluid has leaked out. I am concerned that this will affect future usability and product longevity. I have attached a picture of the damage. I'm hoping the seller will make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Anthony, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Really love this compass
customer_reviews.text: Very nice compass. Feels like a solid and reliable instrument in your hand. Easy to adjust declination. Nice large markings.
customer_reviews.author: Jose from LI

customer_reviews.title: Its a Suunto
customer_reviews.text: Very nice compass, have no issues trusting this compass in any situation.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Best Compass I Own
customer_reviews.text: I own a number of compasses, including 3 global. This is hands down the best one I own. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jackson

customer_reviews.title: expensive but so far worth it
customer_reviews.text: excleelrint it is a Suunto, I do not have any other mirro compasses to compare it to but the Suuto base plate units I ahve are better that Silva and Bruton
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Miami

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a better compass. I like the fact that it will work perfectly anywhere in the world.
customer_reviews.author: lary Breeding

customer_reviews.title: Great quality !
customer_reviews.text: The glowing bezel made it very easy to read !
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, accurate and performs as required
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compass. My previous one is almost identical and lasted 18 yrs, dying from a big fall :( It is good to see a great design only being upgraded for genuine improvements and not for fashion trends. Other well known brands have gone to flexible compass bases that become sticky over time and unreliable. For a precision instrument, this is almost bomb proof.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Overall good compass
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality is good but I am disappointed that the "mirror" is far less reflective than needed. It almost has a brushed finish to it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Good looking compass
customer_reviews.text: So far it looks good. I really like the angle reader.... I think it could help with reading drop rate, for arrow, or bullet drop, as well as deciding weather it's worth navigating different hills or mountains, especially going cross country.
customer_reviews.author: kris vogel

customer_reviews.title: excellent packaging. The compass is definitely great quality
customer_reviews.text: Compass was exactly as ordered; delivered on time; excellent packaging. The compass is definitely great quality. The bezel turns easily, the needle points quickly and is very stable. Markings are all clear and easy to read. Overall an EXCELLENT product with excellent service from Amazon and DIVENDIP. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: diver dan

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zatoichi

customer_reviews.title: A nice compass
customer_reviews.text: The compass is well built and has some great features. Layout is clear and easy to read. Compass is well protected. The compass could benefit from a slightly longer base plate to incorporate the full romer and the romer scale modified to make it easier to read grid co-ordinates. To get around this I have attached a seperate romer card to the lanyard.
customer_reviews.author: Greggles

customer_reviews.title: Needle is stuck / doesn't move freely
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package and found the needle gets stuck and doesn't move freely. Very disappointed. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Adum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great compasses. Easy to read and use. I am still new at learning and this compasses makes it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my boyfriend and he loves it! We took an REI Outdoor Class in which we were taught navigation. This compass was used by an instructor and caught his eye. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Tmcc101

customer_reviews.title: rock solid north
customer_reviews.text: wow, it's rock solid and amazing how steady the needle is. I flip it around to check the settle time, but it just moves to north and stops. Best compass I have ever used, worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: tomg

customer_reviews.title: Great Compass
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband..Very nice compass. He's the expert and says he likes it..
customer_reviews.author: prairiechic

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Mirrored Compass
customer_reviews.text: Good order and delivery service from the Amazon supplier. The device itself is of high quality Finnish origin. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom F

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It has everything a hiker needs for a trip in the wilderness!
customer_reviews.author: Talal AlAnsari

customer_reviews.title: World class mirror compass.
customer_reviews.text: The lanyard and wrist-stopper was too "sticky" for my taste. The quick-release clip is also not secure enough for my taste. But that is just me. I replaced the lanyard with 550 paracord.
customer_reviews.author: Alex (Indonesia)

customer_reviews.title: Steady, durable, and easy to set.
customer_reviews.text: This compass has served me well for over a year now. It is steady: the needle doesn't sway when I'm holding it trying to get my bearing. It is easy to set the declination and use the clinometer, and the mirror is helpful for lining up with my bearing during transit. It is durable! I've worn this in and on my vest for well over a year now, through trees, brush, swamp, mountains, you name it. It's been beat pretty hard, but has just kept on being reliable. I would recommend for any outdoors enthusiast or tradesman, especially a surveyor or field tech.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. O.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for almost any orientering task
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this compass is high quality. I don't prefer mirror compasses for navigation and waypoint identification, but I bought this one for the few few features that make it a fine back-up for my military compass. For this type of compass, this is as fine as they come.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product and what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. Good quality product and what I expected. I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product and as stated on YouTube it's the choice of serious outdoor navagators.
customer_reviews.author: Green Goop

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile Compass
customer_reviews.text: This unit will provide you with appropriate readings on almost every continent (I'm not certain about Anartica). It's tough durable, and not too heavy or bulky. Hiking the world? Get this product, it the only compass you will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Great compass - worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic compass, worth every penny. I hike often and this is a life-saving tool. The mirror doubles as a signal mirror and triples as a body inspection for ticks. You can feel the quality of this compass in your hand (I have 4 compasses).
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Global  needle for entire world
customer_reviews.text: This compass is very easy to use and shoot an azimuth
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A high-quality compass
customer_reviews.text: I am a dayhiker and purchased the Suunto MC-2G compass a few months ago and have been very pleased with its performance. The quality is obvious and it is everything that I expected a top-shelf compass should be. Whenever we are out in the wilderness it is important that we have gear that we can trust and I trust this compass to point me in the right direction! It's not enough just to throw a compass in your pack...make sure you know how to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice compass for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice compass for hiking. Easy to adjust for declination. Mirror. All around pretty decent unit. I do wish the glow was better.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Print Wears off to easy
customer_reviews.text: I love the MC-2G Global Compass this compass it is very accurate, affordable and its a great compass in every way with the exception of the Ink or the Red lettering that wears off too easy. If Suunto would remedy this one little factor it would be a perfect compass. I keep mine in a velvet pouch to keep and prolong it's life. Other wise id give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahomas_OK

customer_reviews.title: Paid for Quality and got it Fast.
customer_reviews.text: I paid for quality and I received it sooner than the estimate mated delivery date. It’s worth every penny.

product_meta.title: SUUNTO MC-2G Global Compass
product_meta.description:
The sighting Compass for global mountaineers. The advanced navigation Compass. When venturing out into unknown territory, these sighting compasses offer precision navigation with a variety of carefully engineered and dependable features for challenging conditions. Fast, globally balanced needle with jewel bearing. Sighting tools for accurate Direction taking. Adjustable declination correction.

AMAZON.COM
Hailing from Suunto's MC series, the top-of-the-line MC-2G global compass is an invaluable tool for people who require highly accurate and reliable directional measurements, such as surveyors, miners, architects, rescue patrols, hikers, boaters, and the military. The MC-2G boasts a fixed declination adjustment system--standard throughout the range--that's especially useful when working in areas with large magnetic variation. The tool's additional sighting hole, meanwhile, ensures superior accuracy, as does the jewel bearing. Add in a mirrored lid, a baseplate with a round magnifying lens, a clinometer that measures the ground slope, and a luminous bezel and markings and you have a versatile, practical compass for a variety of applications. 

 The real star of the MC-2G, however, is its global needle, which works anywhere on the planet. Previously, most compasses functioned well in only one of five geographic zones. That's because the compasses were balanced differently based on the zone's inclination, i.e., the vertical intensity and direction of the Earth's magnetic field. However, as people began to travel more, it became clear that globe-hoppers needed compasses with a greater geographical range. Suunto responded by developing two-zone systems--which work in either the northern or southern hemisphere--and one-zone systems such as the global MC-2G. Now there's no need to purchase several compasses before embarking on your around-the-world eco adventure. 

 The MC-2G, which also sports a red nylon lanyard for around-the-neck use, measures 2.5 by 0.6 by 3.9 inches (W x H x D) with the lid closed and weighs a mere 2.65 ounces. It's also backed by a lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Compact mirrored compass for taking highly accurate and reliable directional measurements
Global needle works anywhere on the planet; base plate with magnifying lens
Fixed declination adjustment system is ideal for areas with large magnetic variation
Extra sighting hole for added precision; luminous bezel and markings for nighttime viewing
